articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli tanks conducted a second day of probing attacks across Rafah on Wednesday, after Washington said the assault did not amount to a major ground incursion of the southern Gazan city that U.S. officials had told Israel to avoid.
articles.title: Israel sends tanks into Rafah on raids amid Gaza-wide offensive

articles.author: Luc Cohen, Jack Queen, Andy Sullivan
articles.description: Jurors in Donald Trump's criminal hush money trial began deliberations on Wednesday, retreating behind closed doors to weigh the evidence and testimony they have heard and seen over the last five weeks.
articles.title: Jury begins deliberations in Trump criminal hush money trial

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: The United States will boycott a United Nations tribute on Thursday to Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi, who was killed earlier this month in a helicopter crash, a U.S. official said.
articles.title: Exclusive: US to boycott UN tribute to Iran leader killed in helicopter crash

articles.author: Anait Miridzhanian, Nqobile Dludla
articles.description: South Africans began voting on Wednesday in the most competitive election since the end of apartheid, with opinion polls suggesting the African National Congress (ANC) will lose its parliamentary majority after 30 years in government.
articles.title: South Africans vote in most competitive election since end of apartheid

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korea fired what appeared to be a ballistic missile, the Japanese government said on Thursday.
articles.title: North Korea fires suspected ballistic missile, Japan says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An Israeli cabinet minister accused Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's coalition of "failing miserably" amid the Gaza war on Wednesday, prompting a rebuke from Netanyahu's Likud party as political divisions deepen.
articles.title: Israeli minister says Netanyahu 'failing,' calls for elections

articles.author: Kanishka Singh
articles.description: Republican former presidential contender Nikki Haley wrote "Finish Them!" on an Israeli artillery shell during a recent visit to Israel, amid an ongoing assault on Gaza that has left tens of thousands dead in the past eight months.
articles.title: Nikki Haley writes 'Finish Them' on Israeli artillery shell, drawing criticism

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: The United Nations Security Council will meet publicly on Friday over North Korea's failed attempt to launch a new military reconnaissance satellite, which the United States described as "reckless and destabilizing behavior."
articles.title: UN Security Council to meet Friday on failed North Korea satellite launch

articles.author: Parisa Hafezi
articles.description: Iran fires the starting gun this week on an election to replace President Ebrahim Raisi, whose death in a helicopter crash could complicate efforts by the authorities to manage a task of even greater consequence - the succession to the supreme leader.
articles.title: Iran's Khamenei seeks trusted hardliner to replace Raisi in June vote

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Protesters delayed traffic in New Zealand's largest city Auckland on Thursday, a transport agency said, following calls by activist groups and opposition party Te Pati Maori to take to the streets to protest the release of the government's budget.
articles.title: Indigenous-led protests stall traffic ahead of New Zealand budget
